queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with wildcard RBAC permissions provide excessive rights to the Kubernetes API and should be avoided. The principle of least privilege recommends to specify only the set of needed objects and actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{flux-edit}}.rules[0].resources should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{flux-edit}}.rules[0].resources uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{crd-controller}}.rules[1].resources uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.
Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{crd-controller}}.rules[5] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{crd-controller}}.rules[5] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch) to Secrets objects

queries.query_name: Service Account Token Automount Not Disabled
queries.description: Service Account Tokens are automatically mounted even if not necessary
Roles and ClusterRoles when binded, should not use get, list or watch as verbs

files.expected_value: The metadata.name={{crd-controller}}.rules.verbs should not contain the following verbs: [["get", "list", "watch"]]

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node

queries.query_name: Cluster Admin Rolebinding With Superuser Permissions
queries.description: Ensure that the cluster-admin role is only used where required (RBAC)

files.expected_value: Resource name 'cluster-reconciler' of kind 'ClusterRoleBinding' isn't binding 'cluster-admin' role with superuser permissions
files.actual_value: Resource name 'cluster-reconciler' of kind 'ClusterRoleBinding' is binding 'cluster-admin' role with superuser permissions

queries.description: Containers should be configured with an AppArmor profile to enforce fine-grained access control over low-level system resources
